title: Low Tide on Grand Pré - best describes structure

content.question: Which of the following best describes the structure of the poem?

choices.label: It begins with the expression of a desire, then imagines the fulfillment of that desire, and finally describes disillusionment with that desire.
It begins with an evening in the present, examines the significance of a memory, and returns to a somewhat later moment the same evening.
The first half describes a dream, and the second half describes awakening from the dream.
Alternating stanzas depict the speaker’s internal and external worlds.

content.answer: It begins with an evening in the present, examines the significance of a memory, and returns to a somewhat later moment the same evening.

skill.text: Skill 3.C: Explain the function of structure in a text.
